title: Introduction to Yoga for PCOD
intro: Begin your journey toward hormonal balance and healing with gentle yoga practices. This session is designed to reduce stress, support reproductive health, and set a mindful intention for managing PCOD.
topics: Understanding PCOD and How Yoga Can Help with Hormonal Balance
Setting an Intention for Healing and Self-Care
Reducing Stress to Support Hormonal Regulation
Creating a Foundation for Consistent Practice

theory.Understanding PCOD and How Yoga Can Help: Polycystic Ovarian Disease (PCOD) is a hormonal disorder that affects many women. Yoga helps by lowering cortisol (stress hormone) levels, stimulating the endocrine system, and promoting better blood flow to the pelvic region.
theory.Setting an Intention for Healing and Sel: Yoga encourages a holistic approach to well-being. Setting an intention at the beginning of your practice fosters commitment, emotional healing, and a deeper connection to your body.
theory.Reducing Stress to Support Hormonal Regu: Chronic stress worsens hormonal imbalances. Gentle yoga postures paired with deep breathing can calm the nervous system and improve hormone regulation.
theory.Creating a Foundation for Consistent Pra: This introductory session prepares your body and mind for long-term benefits. A consistent yoga routine enhances hormonal health, mood stability, and physical strength.

activity: Child’s Pose (Balasana) – Calms the nervous system and reduces stress.
Cat-Cow Pose (Marjaryasana-Bitilasana) – Relieves tension in the lower back and massages the ovaries.
Seated Forward Fold (Paschimottanasana) – Stretches the back and stimulates digestion.
Legs Up the Wall Pose (Viparita Karani) – Improves circulation and reduces stress.

title: Boosting Blood Flow and Improving Digestion
intro: Support your hormonal health by boosting circulation and aiding digestion. This session includes yoga poses that promote blood flow to the pelvic region and stimulate the digestive system—two key areas affected by PCOD.
topics: Enhancing Blood Circulation to Improve Ovarian Health
Improving Digestion, Which is Often Affected in PCOD
Connecting Breath with Movement to Stimulate Internal Organs
Balancing Energy Flow in the Body

theory.Enhancing Blood Circulation to Improve O: Improved blood flow ensures that reproductive organs receive oxygen and nutrients, supporting hormonal balance and reducing symptoms of PCOD.
theory.Improving Digestion, Which is Often Affe: Digestive issues are common in women with PCOD. Yoga postures that involve twists, folds, and core engagement can stimulate the digestive tract and relieve bloating.
theory.Connecting Breath with Movement to Stimu: Conscious breathing during yoga increases oxygen intake and gently massages internal organs, enhancing both circulation and digestion.
theory.Balancing Energy Flow in the Body: Yoga helps clear physical and energetic blockages, allowing for more balanced function of bodily systems including the endocrine and digestive systems.

activity: Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana) – Stimulates blood flow and strengthens the body.
Low Lunge (Anjaneyasana) – Opens the hips and encourages blood flow to the pelvic region.
Bridge Pose (Setu Bandhasana) – Stimulates the thyroid, relieves stress, and helps regulate hormones.
Seated Twist (Ardha Matsyendrasana) – Improves digestion and detoxifies.

title: Balancing Hormones and Relieving Stress
intro: Reduce stress and support hormonal balance through targeted yoga poses and breathing techniques. This session focuses on calming the nervous system and activating endocrine function to manage PCOD symptoms naturally.
topics: Understanding How Stress Affects PCOD and Learning Stress-Relieving Techniques
Balancing Hormones Through Specific Poses
Regulating Cortisol and Supporting Endocrine Health
Using Breathwork to Calm the Mind and Body

theory.Understanding How Stress Affects PCOD an: Stress can worsen PCOD by increasing cortisol levels, which disrupt hormone regulation. Incorporating yoga and mindfulness practices helps lower stress and restore hormonal balance.
theory.Balancing Hormones Through Specific Pose: Certain yoga postures stimulate the endocrine glands, including the ovaries and thyroid, promoting balanced hormone production and improved reproductive health.
theory.Regulating Cortisol and Supporting Endoc: Gentle strength-building and stretching poses help manage cortisol levels and energize the body, supporting a stable hormonal environment.
theory.Using Breathwork to Calm the Mind and Bo: Breathing exercises like Nadi Shodhana help regulate the nervous system, reduce anxiety, and enhance mental clarity—all of which are essential for hormone balance.

activity: Fish Pose (Matsyasana) – Opens the chest and throat area, stimulating the thyroid gland and reducing tension.
Bow Pose (Dhanurasana) – Stimulates reproductive organs, relieves menstrual discomfort, and improves hormonal function.
Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana) – Calms the mind, relieves stress, and promotes overall body balance.
Garland Pose (Malasana) – Opens the hips and pelvic area, grounding energy and aiding digestion.
Camel Pose (Ustrasana) – Stimulates endocrine glands, including the thyroid and adrenals, helping balance hormones naturally.

title: Detoxification and Reducing Inflammation
intro: Support the body's natural detox processes and reduce inflammation—two vital steps in managing PCOD symptoms. This session uses yoga to promote circulation, ease pelvic discomfort, and support overall well-being.
topics: Detoxifying the body and reducing inflammation, key components of managing PCOD.
Using yoga to calm inflammation in the pelvic area.

theory.Detoxifying the body and reducing inflam: Inflammation and toxin buildup can worsen PCOD symptoms. Gentle yoga flows enhance lymphatic drainage and digestion, while targeted poses stimulate internal organs to aid detoxification.
theory.Using yoga to calm inflammation in the p: Certain restorative and twisting poses improve blood flow to the pelvic area, reduce inflammation, and promote a relaxed nervous system—helping manage pain and hormonal imbalances.

activity: Bhujangasana (Cobra Pose) – Opens the chest and stimulates abdominal organs to aid detoxification.
Dhanurasana (Bow Pose) – Enhances circulation and stretches the pelvic region to reduce inflammation.
Paschimottanasana (Seated Forward Bend) – Calms the nervous system and aids digestion.
Ardha Salambasana (Half Locust Pose) – Strengthens the back and stimulates blood flow.
Salamba Sarvangasana (Supported Shoulder Stand) – Improves circulation and supports lymphatic drainage.

title: Strengthening the Core and Pelvic Floor
intro: Focus on building core and pelvic floor strength to improve reproductive health and reduce common PCOD symptoms like pelvic pain and bloating. These exercises help enhance stability, circulation, and overall well-being.
topics: Strengthening the core and pelvic floor to improve reproductive health.
Reducing symptoms of PCOD such as pelvic pain and bloating.
The role of breathwork in strengthening the pelvic floor and reducing stress.
Integrating pelvic floor exercises into daily routines for lasting benefits.

theory.Strengthening the core and pelvic floor: A strong core and pelvic floor provide better support for reproductive organs, improve posture, and enhance circulation, which can positively influence hormonal balance and reduce PCOD symptoms.
theory.Reducing symptoms of PCOD such as pelvic: Targeted core and pelvic floor exercises help alleviate pelvic discomfort and bloating by improving muscle tone and blood flow, which also supports lymphatic drainage.
theory.The role of breathwork in strengthening: Controlled breathing techniques activate the pelvic floor muscles and calm the nervous system, reducing stress-related hormonal imbalances.
theory.Integrating pelvic floor exercises into: Consistent practice of pelvic floor exercises incorporated into daily life ensures long-term health benefits and symptom reduction.

activity: Plank Pose (Phalakasana) – Builds core strength and stability.
Boat Pose (Navasana) – Engages the core and strengthens the pelvic region.
Kegel Exercises – Improve pelvic floor health and circulation.
Locust Pose (Salabhasana) – Strengthens the back and pelvic region.

title: Restorative Yoga and Relaxation
intro: Explore the power of rest in managing PCOD symptoms. This session introduces restorative yoga poses and relaxation techniques that calm the nervous system and support deep healing.
topics: The Importance of Relaxation and Proper Sleep for Managing PCOD Symptoms
Using Restorative Poses to Reset and Rejuvenate the Body

theory.The Importance of Relaxation and Proper: Chronic stress and lack of quality sleep can disrupt hormonal balance and worsen PCOD symptoms. Prioritizing relaxation supports the endocrine system, improves emotional regulation, and enhances overall well-being. Sleep and rest play a crucial role in balancing insulin levels and reducing inflammation.
theory.Using Restorative Poses to Reset and Rej: Restorative yoga uses gentle, supported poses held for extended periods to encourage relaxation and healing. These postures help shift the body into the parasympathetic (rest-and-digest) state, which is essential for hormonal balance and reducing fatigue often associated with PCOD.

activity: Supported Child’s Pose (Balasana) – Kneel on the mat and place a bolster or pillows in front of you. Fold forward, resting your torso and head on the support. Let your arms relax by your sides or forward. Stay for 5–10 minutes, breathing gently.
Legs Up the Wall Pose (Viparita Karani) – Lie on your back and extend your legs up a wall. Rest here for 5–10 minutes to calm the nervous system.
Savasana – Lie flat on your back with arms and legs relaxed. Close your eyes and remain still for 5–10 minutes to promote deep rest.
Gentle Breathing – Practice diaphragmatic breathing, focusing on slow, even breaths to release stress and anchor the mind.
